ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Jan Shikshan Sansthan Adilabad and Institution of Peoples Education was incited and established by the Ministry of Human Resource Development Government of India and functioning under the agies of Social Action for Integrated Development Services a reputed Non Government organization of Adilabad Dist. The Jan Shikshan Sansthan is registered under societies registration act Thirty Five of two thousand one it is an autonomous institution it is having two statutory bodies being and approved by the Ministry of Human Resource Development Government of India. 1 Executive Committee consisting 6 7 dignitaries and empowered to look after all financial matters of the Institution. 2 Board of Management consisting of 15 members with official and eminent non official member empowered to look after all the administrative matters. The main object of JSS is to provideâ€¦â€¦ i) Provide basic literacy , post literacy and continuing education programmes along with vocational education programmes. ii) Provide Vocational training to illiterate, neo-literates persons, people belonging socio-economically weaker section and disadvantaged groups, youth who have received primary education and school with a view to enabling them to retain and upgare their literacy skills and vocational training provided should result in imparting new skills and enhancing existing skills consequently leading to improved confidence and skill levels among the participants for accessing better employment, self employment and income generation possibilities. Priority is required to be given to women in all programmes conducted by the Jan Shikshsan Sansthans. iii) Ensure that training is provided to a pool of resource persons/master trainers/trainers, who could be invited to conduct trainings for the specific groups of trainees for whom trainings is proposed to be conducted. Achievements From 2010-11onwards JSS is stipulated 14 trades Vocational trainings conducting during the tenure of past 6 years around 14900 illiterate women were trained in deferent trades. Round about 45% of the trained women were established their own entrepreneurs. JSS has provided MUDRA Loans for 428 members.

Took up land development programmes 7.Made substantial contribution in the field of building awareness among the masses through kaka jathas by JSS Shramik Chaitanya Kala sena 8. Forged effective collaboration with various departments of both state and central Goverments, local Self Government bodies, NGOs, Public and private enterprises, charitable trusts, UN Bodies and a host of other CBOs. 9. Did substantial work in the fields of Protection of Scheduled castes rights, prevention of atrocities on women , release and rehabilitation of Bonded labour 10. Implemented JSS programmes in the neighbouring Mahboob Nagar District during the years 2004-05 and 2005-06 as entrusted by MHRD 11. Adoption and implementation of all round development project in Manchal Mandal of the District 12. Allotment of 505 sq yards of land in Kukatpally by AP Housing Board 13. Privileged to be the Lead JSS for the JSSs of AP and Director being the member of various State and National level Committees on Child Rights Convention, State Advisory board on child Labour, District Vilgilance and Enforcement Committees on Bonded Labour& child labour& prevention of atrocities on SCs, supervision & Monitoring Officer and Guidance officer for a few JSSs of AP and Orissa States 14 . Actively associated /participated in various Programmes of the Government such as PM SAGY, PMJDY, PMSBY , Swachh Bharath etc. 15.The Evaluations conducted by IIM, Bangalore and Council for Social Development (CSD) ranked the performance of JSS under â€œVery Goodâ€ category.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: JANAPADAM is working in modern theatre and literaure fields for last 32 years. Its Repertory JANAPADAM MODERN TRAVELLING THEATRE REPERTORY is working with the support of Salary Grant Ministry of Culture. JANAPADAM performed its plays in all the districts of Andhra Pradesh and Telangana states. It also performed in the international and national thetare festivals like National School of Dramas BHARATH RANG MAHOTSAV and WORLD SOCIAL FORUM international theatre festival. it is performing aesthetically innovative and socially meaningful theatre. Till today its performances witnessed by nearly 2,50,000 audiences.It performed nearly 1450 shows with 50 plays and trained nearly 2,300 rural, urban and tribal youth, Its chief functionery SRINIVAS DENCHANALA is a well known poet,critic, actor, designer and director. He got Central Sangeet Natak Akademys Junior Fellowship award and Potti Sreeraulu Telugu Universitys prestigious Theatre director Award KEERTHI PURASKARAM. It is planning to construct 300 seat thrust theatre in outskirts of Hyderabad. It also starting one year Diploma in Theatre Arts Course in collaboration with Indira Gandhi National Open University, New Delhi.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Worked on a WASH (Water, Sanitation and Hygiene) project supported by US Consulate meant to educate 500 girls on maintaining cleanliness, hygiene and using toilets responsibly. program included awareness workshops, DIY activity where we taught girls to sew their own cloth pads, Period Quiz and Games and finally handed over a Resource Material to school authorities which becomes a reference guide for girls. We ended the project with distributing cloth pads to girls from United Colors of Benetton

sourceOfFunds.purpose: Period Pride was organized to provide memorable Period Management experience to young girls of an orphanage in the city of Hyderabad. Period Pride focussed on an Awareness Session addressing 350 girls, a talk by a gynaecologist highlighting hygiene practices, nutritional needs and importance of managing Periods safely and hygienically. We organized fun story telling session and distributed hygiene kits to girls which included period essentials for them.

Menstruation forms an integral part of the WASH Project; hence it is important that girls are well trained with appropriate information about managing Menstruation safely and hygienically. They should also be well equipped with unvarying access to products, infrastructure and resources to help them manage their Periods with dignity.

ngoList.title: NARSINGH SWAIN MEMORIAL TRUST
ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: ACHIEVEMENTS OF NARSINGH SWAIN MEMORIAL TRUST The major achievement of the N Swain Memorial Trust is the Aakar [Shape] Asha [Hope] a Super-Specialty hospital for Reconstructive surgery with a built â€“up area of 55,000 sq.ft. in three floors on 2 acres in a strategic location on NH7, the crowded area of once Asiaâ€™s biggest housing localities that is Kukatpally, Hyderabad with an investment of around Rs. 9 crore. The one of its kind project won an award at the 2nd ISB iDiya competition in 2012. Aakar Asha is a referral Centre for Reconstructive Surgery. Apart from Reconstructive Plastic Surgery Orthopedics, Cancer and Pediatric Reconstructive surgeries are done. Specialized services like Oral and Maxillofacial surgery, Dermatology services play a significant role. The allied specialized services that are required for all round requirement of the patient like: Anesthesiologists and Pain management specialists, Physician and Neurologist, Pediatrician, General and Laparoscopic Surgeons and ENT surgeon provide the support services needed for the delightful experience of poor patients during their stay at the Hospital. A state of art Physical Rehab department completes the picture. The hospital has its own 24 x 7 Pharmacy, Diagnostic facilities (clinical pathology, biochemistry and Radiology with Color Doppler), with 3 Operating Theaters [including laminar theater as per NABH guideline], 2 ICUs and Post Op area. It has a capacity of 130 beds with 51 beds in operation of three different categories: General, Sharing and Single rooms other than ICU beds. Besides, the hospital has Dormitory facilities for accommodation of the attendants of the patient during treatment period with in the premises. The kitchen and cafeteria within the premises take care of the patients and their attendantâ€™s dietary needs and provide food for the patientâ€™s attendants. The hospital was built to take care of patient from undivided Andhra Pradesh [presently Telangana and Andhra Pradesh], where the incidence of deformities are high. However, the patient from the neighboring states are been treated with same care and sincerity. The Trust, guided by its objectives, has strived to work for the physically disabled, especially those below poverty line. Activities include creating awareness amongst stakeholders about reconstructive surgery bringing about a transformation in the lives of the physically disabled and helping to identify the beneficiaries; screening camps and reconstructive surgery camps; education and training of doctors and the public. Since 2001, we have conducted more than 30 awareness camps and have distributed literature pertaining to knowledge of physical disability and availability of treatment. No less than 20 free screening camps have been conducted wherein around 1400 persons have been screened for undergoing surgery for physical disability and 900 Physically Disabled persons have undergone reconstructive surgery free of cost since inception of the Trust. 11 Continuing Medical Education programs have been conducted, 8 of which have been the innovative Basic Surgical Skills workshops in which about 250 doctors have been trained hands on. 1 workshop on physiotherapy and a Lifesavers program for first responders have been conducted
